txt.en: Use the summoning horn at the beginning of the tunnel to summon Ausma to your side.
'They won't be digging through THAT any time soon!'
You should talk to Ausma.\n\n<rgb=#FF0000>If Ausma is missing, and the Call Ausma skill is not available, try using the /pet release command.</rgb>
'Well done. Now let's get out of this stinking goblin-tunnel. Why don't we have a drink when we get back, [placeholder]?'
You should talk to Ausma.\n\n<rgb=#FF0000>If Ausma is missing, and the Call Ausma skill is not available, try using the /pet release command.</rgb>
Mission: The Secret Supply Line
Use the Call Ausma skill and talk to Ausma
Destroy supply carts ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Defeat Foreman Strakhfut

You should destroy supply carts throughout Fauthshúg with the bombs Ausma gave you.\n\n<rgb=#FF0000>If Ausma is missing, and the Call Ausma skill is not available, try using the /pet release command.</rgb>
Talk to Ausma
Ausma has said she has an idea, and that you should stand back. You should watch this play out.
Collapse the tunnel
Witness Ausma's \qidea\q
'Well done, [placeholder]! Let us return to the Annâk-khurfu!'
Use the summoning horn to call Ausma
Pick up the Summoning Horn
Defeated Taurogrim ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
'Keep moving, maggots! Gorgar needs those supplies!'
Defeat the Taurogrim in Grazadh-gropor.
TBD
'What is happening up there? Why aren't the supplies moving? If you laggards are sleeping on the job, I swear...'
'Intruders! Make yourselves useful, Orcs, or I'm telling Gorgar this is all your fault!'
Defeat Taurogrim ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Ausma has collapsed the tunnel!
The scouts have discovered a secret underground supply line between Goblin-town and Gundabad. Ausma thinks this is a good opportunity to damage Gorgar's forces.
'Let's put this poor dwarf door out of its misery.'
'Couple more over here should do it....'
Destroyed supply carts ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
'You should really back up.'

'This is surely the right tunnel. The goblins must have dug into this old Longbeard mine and found it leads straight to Gundabad. We're lucky we didn't have to walk the whole way! Now that we have found the supply train, it's time to do some damage. These fools... they thought we would not notice them moving supplies underground and did not assign many guards to protect the caravan, but we are dwarves! We are just as at home under the mountains as they are. They will regret their mistake!

'We need to find the foreman in charge here and defeat him. I assume he will be near the front. Here, take these.'

She pulls out a satchel and hands it to you. Ausma grins mischievously as you peer inside to see a number of small explosives.

'I might have learned a few tricks during my time in Mordor. One of those should be enough to take out each of those carts. Destroy the supplies as we move. If we succeed here, we may be able to prevent them from supplying Gundabad for weeks! Let's move!'
'Now a couple more here to collapse the other side....'
Defeated Foreman Strakhfut
'We should be safe over here.'
'Wait for it....'
Ausma collapses the tunnel!
'BOOM! Haha!'

'Look what they've done to this place! Damn filthy Orcs. I have an idea. We can destroy this foul defacement of dwarf art and remove this tunnel as a supply route to Gundabad all at once.\n\n'You should probably stand back.'
